welcome.title: Welcome to RTSP Recorder
welcome.subtitle: Management interface for Raspberry Pi camera

home.service_action_in_progress_reload: {{service}}: {{action}} in progress... The page will reload.

authentication.title: RTSP / ONVIF Authentication (shared)
authentication.help: Credentials are shared between RTSP and ONVIF (WS-Security). If both username AND password are set, authentication is required to access the RTSP stream. Leave empty for unauthenticated access.

parameters.title: RTSP Parameters
parameters.help: Control the transmitted RTSP video stream and recording, independent of the camera
parameters.sourceModeHelp: Video source used by the RTSP server
parameters.proxyAudioHelp: Relay audio from RTSP source stream

rtsp.applySettingsHelp: Saves and restarts the RTSP service with new settings

onvif.title: ONVIF Service
onvif.help: ONVIF enables automatic camera discovery by NVR recorders and compatible software (Synology Surveillance Station, Blue Iris, etc.).
onvif.urlHelp: Use this URL to add the camera in your NVR/ONVIF software.

videoInfo.title: Announced video parameters
videoInfo.help: Video parameters reported to ONVIF clients are automatically synchronized with Video tab settings.
videoInfo.modifyHint: Modify these values in the Video tab, then restart the ONVIF service.

onvif.name: Camera name

relay.title: GPIO Relay (ONVIF)
relay.help: Exposes an ONVIF relay (DeviceIO) for digital output.

credentials.usernameHelp: Used if RTSP credentials are empty
credentials.passwordHelp: ONVIF WS-Security (ignored if RTSP auth defined)
credentials.rtspPortHelp: RTSP port announced to ONVIF clients
credentials.rtspPathHelp: RTSP path announced to ONVIF clients

sharedCredentials.title: Shared RTSP/ONVIF credentials
sharedCredentials.help: If RTSP credentials are defined, they are automatically used for ONVIF (WS-Security). Otherwise, you can define them above.

helpSection.title: ONVIF Help
helpSection.whatIsAnswer: ONVIF is a standard that allows IP cameras to be automatically detected and configured by video surveillance software.
compatibleList: And any ONVIF Profile S compatible software

preview.title: Live Preview
preview.help: View the camera stream in real-time

device.title: Video Device
device.help: First select the video source (USB or CSI camera)
device.cameraDeviceHelp: Old field used by some scripts - keep identical to VIDEO_DEVICE
device.cameraTypeHelp: Select camera type (Restart required to apply)
device.autoModeNote: Only used when camera type is set to Auto

resolution.title: Video Resolution
resolution.help: Select a resolution supported by your camera
resolution.manualModeHelp: Enable to enter a custom resolution
resolution.fpsHelp: Frames per second (max depends on camera)
resolution.formatHelpLoading: Camera capture format. Loading available formats...

controls.title: Camera Controls
controls.autofocusHelp: Disable to avoid mechanical noise. "Focus" button = single focus then lock.

advancedControls.title: Advanced Camera Settings
advancedControls.help: All available controls for this camera
advancedControls.csiNotice: CSI/PiCam cameras use libcamera and don't support advanced v4l2 controls. Image settings must be configured via libcamera parameters.

profiles.title: Camera Profiles (Day/Night)
profiles.help: Automatically apply settings based on time
profiles.schedulerHelp: Enables automatic profile switching based on defined schedules
profiles.profilesFileHelp: Path to JSON file containing camera profiles

audio.title: Audio Capture
audio.autoHelp: Auto automatically detects if a USB microphone is connected
audio.gainHelp: 0 = mute, 1.0 = normal, 2.0 = x2, 3.0 = x3 (beware of saturation)

recording.title: Recording
recording.noteText: Local recording via RTSP server is not supported with test-launch.
recording.noteCommand: To record, use an external command:
recording.enableHelp: Internal recording is disabled for RTSP stream stability
recording.segmentDurationHelp: Duration of each file in seconds (default: 300 = 5 min)
recording.minFreeDiskHelp: Disk space to keep free. Oldest recordings will be deleted to respect this limit. 0 = no limit.
recording.maxDiskHelp: 0 = no limit. If set, total space used by recordings is capped.

player.title: Playback
player.unsupported: Your browser does not support video playback.

priority.title: Interface Priority
priority.help: Drag and drop to reorder priority. The top interface will be used first if available.

ipConfig.title: IP Configuration
ipConfig.missing_ip_gateway: Please fill in IP address and gateway
ipConfig.static_ip_required: Please enter a static IP address

ethernetPriority.title: Ethernet / WiFi Priority
ethernetPriority.help: If enabled, WiFi on wlan0 will be automatically disabled when Ethernet is connected, unless you manually force WiFi activation.
ethernetPriority.forceWifiHelp: When enabled, WiFi stays active even if Ethernet is connected

accessPoint.title: Access Point Mode (AP)
accessPoint.help: Turns wlan0 into a WiFi access point to allow direct connection from a smartphone/PC. Settings are managed by Meeting.
accessPoint.warning: Warning: Access Point mode uses wlan0, which disables hardware WiFi failover. However, wlan1 (USB dongle) remains available for network failover to another WiFi.
accessPoint.password_min_length: Password must be at least 8 characters
accessPoint.missing_config: AP configuration missing. Check that Meeting is provisioned.
accessPoint.missing_password: AP password missing. Check that Meeting is provisioned.

wifiFailover.title: WiFi Configuration with Failover
wifiFailover.help: Two failover levels: Hardware (if USB dongle is removed ‚Üí use built-in WiFi) and Network (if primary access point is unavailable ‚Üí use backup network).

hardware.title: Hardware Failover (Interface)
hardware.help: Automatic switch between physical WiFi dongles. The primary dongle is used if present, otherwise the secondary takes over.
hardware.enableHelp: If disabled, only the primary interface will be used
hardware.primaryHelp: Used as priority if physically present

network.title: Network Failover (SSID)
network.help: Automatic switch between two WiFi networks. The primary network is used if available, otherwise the secondary.
network.enableHelp: If disabled, only the primary network will be used

ipShared.title: IP Configuration (Shared)
ipShared.help: This IP configuration will be applied regardless of the active interface or network.

power.gpu_confirm:
Change GPU memory to {{memory}} MB?
A reboot will be required.
power.apply_hint: This may take a few seconds
power.reboot_confirm:
Are you sure you want to reboot the Raspberry Pi?
The connection will be lost for a few minutes.

services.tty1: Login on HDMI screen (unused when headless)

energy.title: Energy Management & LEDs
energy.help: Save energy by disabling unused components. Changes will persist after reboot.
energy.ledCameraCsiHelp: Red LED on Pi Camera module
energy.ledEthNotSupported: Not controllable on this model (LEDs managed by PHY)
energy.changesNote: Note: Changes will take effect on next system reboot.

gpuMemory.title: GPU Memory
gpuMemory.help: GPU memory allocation. More GPU memory = better video performance but less available RAM.

ntp.title: Time Synchronization (NTP)
ntp.help: Configure the NTP server to synchronize system time.
ntp.rtcHelp: Uses RTC clock to keep time without network.

scheduledReboot.title: Scheduled Reboot
scheduledReboot.help: Schedule an automatic reboot at a specific time.

update.title: Update from repo
update.help: Update the system from the GitHub repo.

backup.title: Backup / Restore
backup.help: Backup and restore local configuration (logs optional).

meeting.title: Meeting API Integration
meeting.subtitle: Centralized IoT management

connection.title: Connection Status
connection.configureHelp: Configure settings below to enable integration

provisioning.title: Device Provisioning
provisioning.help: Enter your Meeting credentials to provision this device. This operation consumes a token and locks the configuration.

deviceInfo.title: Device Information (Meeting)
deviceInfo.loadHelp: Click "Device info" to load data from Meeting

tunnels.title: Tunnels (Remote Services)
tunnels.help: Request a reverse tunnel to access the device from outside

masterReset.title: Master Reset
masterReset.warning: Warning! This action will reset the Meeting configuration. The device hostname will not be modified.

meeting.ssh_key_generate_confirm: Generate a new SSH key? The old key will be overwritten.
meeting.ssh_full_setup_confirm:
Start full SSH setup?

‚Ä¢ Key generation
‚Ä¢ Publish to Meeting
‚Ä¢ Hostkey sync
meeting.status_enter_credentials: Enter your credentials to provision this device
meeting.provision_click_to_continue: Click "Provision device" to continue. This will consume 1 token.
meeting.device_not_authorized: This device is not authorized in Meeting.
meeting.provision_confirm:
Are you sure you want to provision this device?

This will:
- Consume 1 provisioning token
- Change the device hostname
- Lock Meeting configuration
meeting.hostname_access_hint: After a few seconds, you can access the UI at:
meeting.backup_restore_confirm:
{{info}}

Do you want to restore this backup?
meeting.backup_restore_confirm_reboot:
Restore configuration from this backup?

The Raspberry Pi will reboot.
meeting.onvif_name_from_meeting: Name retrieved automatically from Meeting API (product_serial)
meeting.onvif_name_default_hint: Meeting API not configured - default name used
meeting.firmware_initramfs_tooltip: initramfs detected - use apt upgrade below
meeting.firmware_update_confirm:
Do you want to update the firmware?

A reboot will be required after the update.
meeting.firmware_update_warning_rpi:
‚ö†Ô∏è WARNING: rpi-update installs EXPERIMENTAL firmware!

This may cause system instability.
Use only if you know what you are doing.

Do you want to continue?
meeting.firmware_download_install:
Downloading and installing firmware...
This may take several minutes, please wait...
meeting.apt_refreshing:
Refreshing package lists...
This may take a few minutes...
meeting.apt_all_up_to_date: All packages are up to date
meeting.apt_upgrade_confirm:
Do you want to update all packages?

This may take several minutes.
meeting.apt_installing:
Installing updates...
This may take several minutes, please wait...
meeting.terminal_sudo_note: Note: Use "sudo" before a command for root privileges.

advanced.title: Advanced Settings
advanced.lowLatencyHint: Optimizes for minimal RTSP stream latency

profile.name: Profile name
profile.captureHelp: Click "Capture" to save current camera settings to this profile

updateRepo.title: Update from repo
updateRepo.forceReinstallHelp: Useful for corrupted files or incomplete deployment.
updateRepo.resetSettingsHelp: Deletes local configuration to start fresh.

confirm.reboot: Are you sure you want to reboot the Raspberry Pi?
confirm.delete: Are you sure you want to delete this file?
confirm.deleteMultiple: Are you sure you want to delete {count} files?
confirm.reset: Are you sure you want to reset?

i18n.title: Language
i18n.uploadHelp: JSON file must follow the structure of existing translations. Use the button below to download a template.
i18n.dropFile: Click or drop a JSON file
i18n.invalid_file: Invalid file. Use a JSON file.
i18n.no_lang_code: Language code not found in file

diagnostics.preview_unavailable_subtitle: Check that the camera is connected
diagnostics.csi_not_installed_body: To control CSI camera settings, install Picamera2:
diagnostics.csi_starting_body: The CSI RTSP server is starting. Auto-reload in 3 seconds.
diagnostics.csi_busy_body: The CSI camera is currently used by the RTSP stream.
diagnostics.confirm_stop_rtsp:
Stop the RTSP stream to configure the camera?
Connected clients will be disconnected.
diagnostics.csi_reset_confirm: Reset all CSI settings to default values?
diagnostics.adv_live_apply_notice: Changes are applied in real time to the video stream
diagnostics.adv_no_controls: No controls available for this camera
diagnostics.confirm_restart_rtsp: Restart the RTSP stream? Connected clients will be disconnected.
diagnostics.rtsp_restarted: Stream restarted - settings are now active
diagnostics.profiles_empty_body: Create profiles to automate day/night settings.
diagnostics.profile_no_controls: No saved settings in this profile.
diagnostics.profile_capture_confirm:
Capture current settings into profile "{{profile}}"?
This will replace existing settings.
diagnostics.profile_ghostfix_confirm:
Apply ghost-fix to profile "{{profile}}"?
This disables AE/AWB and centers brightness.

recordings.confirm_delete_files: Are you sure you want to delete {{count}} file(s)?
recordings.format_ts_download: Format .ts - Download to play locally
recordings.confirm_delete_file: Are you sure you want to delete "{{filename}}"?

navigation.rtsp_auth_enabled_html:
Authentication enabled - User "{{user}}" is required to access the RTSP stream.
URL: rtsp://{{user}}:****@IP:PORT/PATH
navigation.rtsp_auth_incomplete_html: Authentication incomplete - You must provide both username AND password to enable authentication.
navigation.rtsp_auth_disabled_html: Authentication disabled - The RTSP stream will be accessible without a password. Set a username and password to secure access.
